name: GetAsanaWebhooks
description:
Retrieve all registered Asana webhooks for a workspace.

Use this tool to get a compact representation of all webhooks registered by your app for the authenticated user in a specified Asana workspace. Requires the 'webhooks:read' scope.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Asana workspace to query for webhooks.

value_schema.description: The workspace to query for webhooks in.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Number of webhooks to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: An offset token to retrieve the next page of results. Use the token from a previous API response for pagination.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: specific_resource
parameters.description: Specify the resource ID to filter webhooks for that particular resource.

value_schema.description: Only return webhooks for the given resource.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response, which are excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true for a readable, pretty-formatted JSON output. Increases response time and size. Use mainly for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The workspace to query for webhooks in.

value_schema.description: The workspace to query for webhooks in.

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Only return webhooks for the given resource.

value_schema.description: Only return webhooks for the given resource.
